page.title: 02INTRODUCTION TO THE FARM
page.content: THE FARM IS OWNER OCCUPIED AND THERE ARE ABOUT 300 ACRES ATTATCHED TO IT. THE FARM WAS BOUGHT BY THE PRESENT FARMER'S FATHER WHO STILL LIVES ON THE LAND. THE FARMER AND HIS WIFE LIVE IN THE HOUSE ATTATCHED TO THE FARM WHICH IS PARTLY ELIZABETHAN BUT HAS BEEN ADDED TO MANY TIMES SINCE. THE HOUSE IS BUILT ON NORMAN FOUNDATIONS. THE RIDGES AND FURROWS OF THE OLD FIELD SYSTEMS CAN STILL BE SEEN. THE FARMER AND HIS WIFE BOTH FARM THE LAND, BOTH HAVE THEIR OWN SPECIFIC JOB. IT IS A MIXED FARM WITH BOTH ARABLE AND ANIMAL REARING PRACTICED. THE ANIMALS ARE BEEF STOCK,BULLOCK COWS AND CALVES. THE BULLOCKS ARE SOLD FOR BEEF THE COWS ARE KEPT FOR BREEDING AND FOR FEEDING THE CALVES. ONLY MALE CALVES ARE KEPT AS THEY WILL JOIN THE BEEF HERD.
